head.supplied: 7/1/96 ¶ ¶ It was very kind of you, dear Madam, to send me the new lot of seaweeds and also the dried specimens of the land-plants. I find among these plants some few to be new for W.A. and some new ...

div.p: Letters to Mrs Ryan of Eucla, acc. 2146A, Battye Library, Perth.

It was very kind of you, dear Madam, to send me the new lot of seaweeds and also the dried specimens of the land-plants. I find among these plants some few to be new for W.A. and some new for SA.; the new locality will be mentioned in my works, under your honored name. Let me hope that you will continue to send both seaweeds and land-plants as gradually opportunities may arise for you to get any. Perhaps friends near you would collect also and send their gatherings to you. You packed the specimens admirably. I will send you from time to time seeds of new vegetables and other economic plants, as I may able to obtain them.
